thread.title: Elmira volleyball player gets a win and engagement ring
thread.title_full: Elmira volleyball player gets a win and engagement ring

title: Elmira volleyball player gets a win and engagement ring
text:
Elmira volleyball player gets a win and engagement ring Andrew Legare, alegare@stargazette.com | @SGAndrewLegare 9:04 p.m. EDT October 15, 2015 Soaring Eagles senior Ashley Heiman gets engaged during the match David Lucas proposes to Elmira College volleyball player Ashley Heiman on Thursday at Speidel Gym in Elmira. (Photo: Provided by Elmira College) 5 CONNECT 14 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Elmira College women's volleyball team swept visiting Cazenovia College on Thursday night at Speidel Gymnasium. The big winner of the night, though, was David Lucas. 
In between the second and third sets, Lucas asked Elmira senior volleyball player Ashley Heiman to marry him, with an estimated crowd of 225 fans watching. Heiman, a native of Dansville who attended Wayland-Cohocton High School, said "yes" as her parents, Anne and Michael Heiman, watched from the stands. 
According to a press release from the college, Lucas traveled to Elmira from Laughlin Air Force Base in Del Rio, Texas, for the surprise proposal. 
Heiman's night also included a match-high 10 kills as Elmira won 25-17, 26-24, 25-16 to improve to 13-8. Sami Hanes added 24 setter assists for Elmira and Amanda Blinkinsop contributed 15 digs. 
Cazenovia dropped to 4-14. 
Elmira hosts the Elmira College Invitational on Friday and Saturday. 
On Twitter: @SGAndrewLegare Read or Share this story: http://stargaz.tt/1LwxoXT TOP VIDEOS
